CatDescriptText: Sam Hill, dining car employee, 1919 Webster Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 21, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you favor an increase in state sales tax or a graduated income tax as a means of raising revenue for a commonwealth of Pennsylvania?" answer reads: "I don't favor either, because there is too much tax. I think that there is enough money coming in already, and what is needed is some good budgeting."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Sam Hill wearing herringbone coat, fedora, and light colored patterned tie, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
